review_title: An exciting time for an evolving organization
pros:
This organization has undergone a lot of transformation and soul searching in the last 1-2 years, which included broadening its scope beyond just accreditation through the establishment of HSO (Health Standards Organization). This has been an exciting change in the organization, as we are able to explore many different ways that we can improve healthcare quality on a global scale.  

The organization is very open to new ideas and new ways of doing things. If you're a hard worker and don't shy from a challenge, then there are some great projects and portfolios that you can get involved in.  

Senior leadership are accessible to staff at all levels and understand that in this time of innovation, we might not always get it right and it may be a little messy.  This means staff can have the freedom to test and try new products and programs. 

The people are really great, and a mix of many new staff and established staff who have been there for many years means  a wealth and diversity of experience, ideas and knowledge from various sectors.  

If there are areas that interest you and you indicate that, management will likely try to find a way to ensure that you can participate and collaborate on those projects, even if you're not directly tied to that portfolio.   

Salaries are very competitive, with a great benefits package. 

Flexible working hours and ability to work from home is very convenient.
cons:
Several structural changes within the organization has created some ambiguity and lack of clarity in terms of processes and accountabilities.  For many individuals, who  work best within a very clear framework and structure, this has been challenging and exhausting, resulting in levels of negativity among some staff.  While this is a con for many, for people enjoy building their own structure and collaborating with others to navigate new ways of doing things, this can be very positive as well. 

The organization has big ambitions and lofty goals about improving healthcare quality on a global scale, meaning that both the projects and the timelines can be intimidating.

review_title: Great potential for growth but struggling with HR management
pros:
- New CEO (Feb 2016) is rapidly transforming the organization for aggressive growth and new identity (and plan seems to make sense)
- Top employer in Ottawa for 6 years in a row
- High salaries
- International expansion / job opportunities for those interested in international work
- Excellent benefits
- Pension Fund
- Gym onsite, dragon boat team
- Nice office space, building recently built and owned by organization
- Parking onsite at very low cost (deducted on pay check)
- Big ambition
- Sense of family among employees
cons:
- Constantly reorganizing, little stability which means people are constantly re-learning, re-organizing, re-calibrating
- Not-for-profit / Charity mission is progressively disappearing in favor of a private sector/growth approach (not necessarily a con for everyone though)
- Senior management outside CEO/CFO has limited experience of managing growth oriented organizations with a private sector mentality. Not the right mix of skills/experience to support where it wants to go but hiring new executives in 2017. 
- Little job security on the Canadian accreditation side
- Overtime, long work hours on the International accreditation side
- High salaries but no variable compensation (hence the 4 out of 5 stars for Compensation below)
- Change fatigue among staff

review_title: Toxic work environment is contributing to enormous staff turnover
pros:
1: The people outside of senior management
2: Facilities are quite good with an on-site gym and shower
3: Benefits and pension
cons:
This organization’s leadership is clearly disconnected with staff as well as the board of directors. Considering that someone from leadership had to post fake reviews earlier to counteract all the real, honest reviews from staff, one should take that as an indication of leadership trying to block what’s really happening here.

While this place was never a great place to work at, there was a sense of community and camaraderie that kept us going. Now the dysfunction of leadership has created a place where turnover has exceeded 60%. Funny how we no longer even try to get a top 25 employer status, it’s laughable.

review_title: Bleeding people, bleeding clients, bleeding money... I agree with the other reviewers
pros:
30 dollar gym 
Nap room
Parking 
Elevator and ramps
Nice building
Showers
cons:
I agree with all the comments from other reviewers. A very low performing very mediocre organization offers neither stability nor motivation to employees. As one reviewer said, “what they do to employees is illegal” You have to stop eliminating positions while reinventing the company every two years. There has to be some stability. You could be an example to follow for hospitals to offer stability. Why do you say on your website and materials that you have 60 years of experience? If so, can you please name 10 employees who have survived more than one year of abrupt changes in your organization?  There is no need to post the 2017 organization picture again and again in 2019. You could be posting the current 2019 picture when you have nothing to hide. Do hospitals post 2017 pictures before a mass lay off? 
You do not know or do not care how much talent costs you to reinvent the organization every year. One former employee mentioned that this organization is going to be taken to courts.  I am not sure how much this organization spends in legal battles but this progressive massive layoff for the past 5 years has to stop.  When you offer the best product in the world, there is no need to get rid of employees all the time because there is a clear direction.  Why this organization wastes millions of dollars hiring and contracting people instead of fixing the product? Just stop blaming employees for leaders who do not know where this organization should go. Please offer some stability to employees.
